intro: Hieracium sonchoides subsp. malacotrichodes, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this species thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and botanical studies.
